title: Raspberry Pi CM5 is a faster, drop-in upgrade
dot:
digraph CM5_Overview{rankdir=LR;node[shape=rect, style=rounded, fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=12];CM5[label="Raspberry Pi Compute Module 5 (CM5)
 - 2-3x Faster CPU
 - USB 3.0, PCIe Gen 3
 - 3-4x Faster RAM
 - Compatible with CM4 Accessories"];CM4[label="Compute Module 4 (CM4)
 - Older Hardware
 - Slower CPU & RAM
 - USB 2.0, PCIe Gen 2"];CM5_Benchmark[label="CM5 Benchmarking
 - Boot Time: +4s
 - CPU Speed: 3x Faster
 - Video Encoding: 3x Faster
 - Power: 2x More on Full Load
 - RAM Speed: 2-3x Faster"];CM5_UseCases[label="CM5 Use Cases
 - 4K Gaming
 - Kubernetes Cluster
 - Commercial Displays
 - eGPU Support
 - Various Carrier Boards"];CM5_Hardware[label="CM5 Hardware
 - BCM2712 D0 SoC (4x Cortex-A76)
 - LPDDR4x RAM
 - USB-C, PCIe Gen 3

 - 8GB Model: $75
 - 4GB Model: $45
 - 2GB Model: $45
 - 1GB Dropped"];CloneComparison[label="CM5 vs Clones
 - Radxa CM5 with RK3588S2
